name: TheAtlantic
text: "One conclusion to draw from Monday’s denial to hear those cases is that Chief Justice Roberts may not be so in favor of broadly expanding the scope of the Second Amendment," @adamwinkler writes: https://t.co/DToggsEglT

name: TheAtlantic
text: Over the course of the coronavirus crisis, @khushbuoshea’s relatives have sent her homeopathic “cures,” astrological charts predicting the end of the pandemic, and conspiracy theories. She writes about why misinformation spreads in families: https://t.co/QIRsOM5e30

name: TheAtlantic
text: "When the fateful moment arrives, Trump would need to accept that same sobering reality that [Al] Gore absorbed: He lost," @PeterAtlantic writes. https://t.co/iFfPADfBjb

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos: Cautious Reopenings Across Europe—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/gu0D6m76RY

name: TheAtlantic
text: Gordon Parks' work for Life magazine "did nothing less than revolutionize what a 'crime photo' could look like," the magazine's former editor-in-chief, @Bill_Shapiro writes. https://t.co/vCX7rWl9x0

name: TheAtlantic
text: iPads wrapped in plastic bags. Zoom goodbyes. The coronavirus made caring for the sickest patients “an entirely new universe,” @sarahzhang reports. https://t.co/BgewNJpltJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Social-media callouts have been criticized as a distraction from on-the-ground activism, but recent weeks have shown that they’re part of the protest, @skornhaber writes: https://t.co/RrewRglmVe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Understanding the present moment requires grappling with a history stained by racial inequity. We compiled a list of writing on race and racism spanning @TheAtlantic's 163-year history: https://t.co/WN4hnuyQex
